Event.0: Swedish screenwriter and director Ingmar Bergman—who was known for his bleak depiction of human loneliness, vulnerability, and torment—died.
Event.1: Pop star Britney Spears (25) divorces rapper-dancer Kevin Federline (29) due to irreconcilable differences after over two years of marriage
Event.2: Actor Nicolas Cage (40) weds Alice Kim (20) at a private ranch in Northern California
Event.3: Hollywood's highest-paid screenwriter Joe Eszterhas (49) weds Naomi Baka (35) in Maui, Hawaii
Event.4: James Ogilvy (under Engl princess Alexandra) marries Julia Rawlinson
Event.5: Former Teamsters president Jimmy Hoffa disappeared under mysterious circumstances.
Event.6:
Christopher Nolan
British director
was born
Event.7:
Laurence Fishburne
American actor
was born
Event.8:
Richard Linklater
American filmmaker
was born
Event.9:
Kate Bush
British singer and songwriter
was born
Event.10: The phrase “In God we trust” legally became the national motto of the United States.
Event.11: Elvis Presley joins the Memphis Federation of Musicians, Local 71
Event.12: Professional wrestling premieres on prime-time network TV (DuMont)
Event.13:
Arnold Schwarzenegger
American politician, actor, and athlete
was born
Event.14: Frank Sinatra sang with the Tommy Dorsey Orchestra in his last recording before venturing on a solo career.
Event.15: Russian Politburo issues NKVD Order no. 00447, to repress former kulak and anti-soviets, 269,100 to be arrested, 76,000 to be shot. Part of the Great Purge.
Event.16: American blues musician Buddy Guy, who was noted for his slashing electric guitar riffs and passionate vocals, was born in Lettsworth, Louisiana.
Event.17: 1st Penguin book is published, starting the paperback revolution
Event.18: Uruguay defeated Argentina to win the first World Cup in football (soccer).
Event.19: 1st FIFA World Cup Final, Estadio Centenario, Montevideo, Uruguay: Uruguay beats Argentina, 4-2 in the inaugural event
Event.20: Insulin was first isolated as a pancreatic extract by the Canadian scientists Sir Frederick G. Banting and Charles H. Best.
Event.21:
Death of Otto von Bismarck
Otto von Bismarck—who, as prime minister of Prussia (1862–73, 1873–90), used ruthlessness and moderation to unify Germany, founding the German Empire (1871) and serving as its first chancellor (1871–90)—died this day in 1898.
Event.22: Nonpareil Dempsey [John Edward Kelly] fights George Fulljames, possibly the 1st middleweight fight with boxing gloves
Event.23: The Charles, considered the world’s first "oil tanker", departs from the United States headed for Europe with a bulk capacity of 7,000 barrels of oil
Event.24: American industrialist and automobile manufacturer Henry Ford, who revolutionized factory production with his assembly-line methods, was born.
Event.25: Indian Wars: Chief Pocatello of the Shoshone tribe signs the Treaty of Box Elder, promising to stop harassing the emigrant trails in southern Idaho and northern Utah
Event.26: House of Burgesses Virginia forms, 1st elective American governing body
Event.27: Lutheran clergyman Robert Barnes was burned as a heretic after being used by Thomas Cromwell and King Henry VIII to gain European support for their antipapal movement in England.
Event.28: First defenestration of Prague: anti-Catholic Hussites, followers of executed reformer Jan Hus, storm Prague town hall and throw the judge, mayor and several city council members out the windows. They die in the fall or killed by crowd outside.
Event.29: Frederick I (Barbarossa), Holy Roman Emperor, crowned King of Burgundy
